ygData.subject: Re: [EverQuest] Re: EQ video question
ygData.msgSnippet: Ok here is the difference with me and my friend s. I have a Geoforce2 with 32MB ram his is the intel system board 32 MB . Mine actually runs ok but I need to
ygData.messageBody:
Ok here is the difference with me and my friend's.
I have a Geoforce2 with 32MB ram his is the intel
system board 32 MB .

Mine actually runs ok but I need to use 800 x 600, no
luclin images, meaning people stuff, and some other
minor tweaks.

If I use the old UI it runs smoother.
But the 32MB card in mine seems ok or do you think a
better card will REALLY help.

Thanks

--- mlockridge01 <MLockridge01@...> wrote:
> What is the brand of your card? A gforce 3 or gforce
> 4ti will
> probably be your best improvement. Then more memory.
> At the present
> prices you could probably get a gforce 3 plus up
> your memory to 512
> for around $200. It would be a good move. I have
> even seen gforce 4ti
> for around $175. Hopefully you have agp slots. I
> have only pci, so I
> cannot do as I have recommended for you. sigh.
>
> Barto Proudfoot
>
> --- In EverQuest@y..., Rob LeBeau <rlebeau65@y...>
> wrote:
> > I just bought a new machine and have a question.
> I
> > had some Mouse issues but I solved those but now I
> get
> > a little skip in the movement when I run or walk.
>
> >
> > It is like frame by frame. The machine is a 1.2
> GHZ
> > machine with 384 Ram and 32 MB video card.
> >
> > Now, my question is, "Does the video card with EQ
> make
> > the difference or is it RAM?" The reason I ask is
> > because when you choose the Luclin images it tells
> you
> > how many to pick based on Ram and not Video
> memory.
> >
> > So does EQ use RAM more so than Video ram or not?
> > I don't mind getting a 64 MB video card but I want
> it
> > to work.
> >
> > My friend also sees the same issues but only has
> 256
> > mb ram
> >
> > Thanks
> >
> > __________________________________________________

> > http://health.yahoo.com
>
